snippet: Several journalists who write about Myanmar have received warnings from Google that their Gmail accounts may have been hacked by “state-sponsored attackers.”
abstract: Several journalists who cover Myanmar say that they have received warnings from Google that their e-mail accounts may have been hacked by 'state-sponsored attackers'; some journalists speculate that attempts to hack into e-mail accounts might be linked to conflict in northern Myanmar, where ethnic Kachin rebels are fighting government troops for control over territory near Chinese border.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe contributed reporting from Laiza, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: Several journalists who write about Myanmar have received warnings from Google that their Gmail accounts may have been hacked by “state-sponsored attackers.”

headline.seo: Journalists’ E-Mail Accounts Targeted in Myanmar
headline.main: E-Mails of Reporters in Myanmar Are Hacked
headline.print_headline: E-Mails Of Reporters In Myanmar Are Hacked
